body_html: @fritzo - Continuing the thread from probtorch#85, do we want to add .new methods to the distributions directly, or just use param.new() as needed? The former seems a bit ambiguous to me since the parameters' shape might be different from the distribution's sample shape.
body_text: @fritzo - Continuing the thread from probtorch#85, do we want to add .new methods to the distributions directly, or just use param.new() as needed? The former seems a bit ambiguous to me since the parameters' shape might be different from the distribution's sample shape.
body: @fritzo - Continuing the thread from https://github.com/probtorch/pytorch/pull/85, do we want to add `.new` methods to the distributions directly, or just use `param.new()` as needed? The former seems a bit ambiguous to me since the parameters' shape might be different from the distribution's sample shape.
